lines.text: Mr. Drew, I've been thinking.
No!
Yeah. The first thing I ask myself when I investigates a murder is 'who done it'.
Well that sounds logical.
And the next thing I ask myself is 'who could do it.'
And then?
Then I ask myself again 'who wanted to do it.'
And how do you answer yourself?
Well... I ain't come to that yet.
Poison, all right. Familiar smelling stuff too.

[smells glass]
Boy! That guy'd drink anything that wasn't too thick to chew.
Everybody here seems to know more about police matters than the police.
It's noble of you to admit it.
I've just come from Chalmers' place. He's dead.
Chalmers?
Poisoned.
You mean murdered?
If it isn't that, it's a good imitation of it.
Say, will you go up to your office and write bad little boy five hundred times?
I guess I used uncanny skill.
I'm beginnin' to think you're givin' us the razz.
Prove it. You're the detective.
What are you and that Keystone Cop doing here?
Now lookie here, Sheehan, you can't talk that way about me. Remember, I'm Chief of the Studio Police and I got rights! I... I...
Nature in the raw.
Well, that's that old, old story. Two men and a woman. The internal triangle.
It's as simple as A-B-C.
Yes it would be if you thought of it.
